Yup. Also I've replaced smallvec with tinyvec in one of the dependencies, so there's very little unsafe in the dependency graph too.
Consider also looking into attohttpc, the API is a bit nicer and it supports a different (although not superior) set of features. The downside is pointless unsafe code in dependency tree, e.g. bytes
although the smallvec removal apparently didn't make into a crates.io release, I guess I'll have to poke the relevant maintainers
Okay, it's released now. tinyvec download count is about to skyrocket
